Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Therapeutic Plasma Exchange in Cardiac Surgery Patients with Heparin-Induced Thrombocytopenia

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive TPE with heparin re-exposure or standard care.

Participants.evidence: Conducted at a tertiary care center, this randomised controlled trial included patients diagnosed with HIT requiring cardiac surgery with CPB.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive TPE with heparin re-exposure or standard care.

Objective.evidence: This study assesses the efficacy of intraoperative therapeutic plasma exchange (TPE) in reducing thromboembolic events, bleeding, and mortality in HIT patients undergoing CPB.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of HIT-related thromboembolic events within 7 days post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Due to the intervention's nature, blinding was not feasible.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 24 patients were randomised, with 12 in each group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The effect size for thromboembolic events was not statistically significant (p > 0.05).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar across groups, with no severe complications reported.
